Title: Callosal and prefrontal associational projecting cell populations in area 7A of the macaque monkey: a study using retrogradely transported fluorescent dyes.
Abstract: The spatial interrelationship of neurons in area 7a in the inferior parietal lobule that project through the corpus callosum to the corresponding field in the contralateral hemisphere or to the ipsilateral prefrontal cortex has been analyzed in macaque monkeys by using double-labeling procedures with retrogradely transported fluorescent dyes. The populations of callosal and associational projecting neurons have similar laminar distributions and are topographically intermingled. Less than 1% of the neurons were double-labeled, thus suggesting that the two populations are largely separate. Two-dimensional reconstructions of the distribution of labeled cells made on flattened reconstructions of the inferior parietal lobule revealed that the areal distribution of the two cortico-cortical output arrays is complex. Although each pattern of labeling showed some discontinuities in density, there was no obvious periodicity within or between the spatial distributions of the two projecting populations. It was consistently observed that the cortex of the lateral wall of the intraparietal sulcus, adjacent to area 7a, projects more heavily to the prefrontal cortex than does area 7a itself.

@InterMapRelations.Citation: "The middle temporal area was identified by using a modification of a myelin stain (Gallyas, 1979) as suggested by Van Essen et al. (1982)." (p. 444) "The middle temporal area (MT) by its dense myelination as seen in preparations stained by a modification of the Gallyas (1979) technique (Van Essen et al., 1982)." (legend to Fig. 1)
"The extent of area PG was determined using the cytoarchitecural criteria of von Bonin and Bailey (1947)." (legend to Fig. 1)

"The extent of area PG was determined using the cytoarchitecural criteria of von Bonin and Bailey (1947). Contained within area PG are the lateral intraparietal area (LIP) and area 7a; the boundaries of these areas were determined on the basis of their connections." (legend to Fig. 1)

"The extent of area PG was determined using the cytoarchitecural criteria of von Bonin and Bailey (1947). Contained within area PG are the lateral intraparietal area (LIP) and area 7a; the boundaries of these areas were determined on the basis of their connections." (legend to Fig. 1)

"The cortex of the lateral intaparietal sulcus has been identified as a separate cortical field (area POa) by Seltzer and Pandya (1980)...Our material further suggests that the cortex in the caudal aspect of the lateral wall of the intraparietal sulcus can be distinguished on the basis of its other connections...We are designating this region the lateral intraparietal area (LIP)...It is contained within the caudal half of area POa." (p. 453)
"...area 7a...is located medially on the lateral convexity of the inferior parietal lobule."

@Injections.Citation: "Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...In case 83A-4 a single dye injection was made into area 7a...In 83A-8 the injection site also included parts of areas 7b and LIP, but in the other two cases the injections were strictly confined to area 7a."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "The findings in all three cases were essentially identical." (p. 446)
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: The results of this injection were not described explicitly, neither in the text nor by the figures.

@Injections.Citation: "Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...in case 83A-5 three tightly spaced injections were made near the center of area 7a...In 83A-8 the injection site also included parts of areas 7b and LIP, but in the other two cases the injections were strictly confined to area 7a."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: Fig. 4: "For the prefrontal sections...each filled triangle represents several fast-blue-labeled neurons that projected to area 7a of the same side."
Fig. 4: "In the drawings of the posterior parietal sections the filled triangles represent fast-blue-labeled neurons that project callosally to 7a..."
@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: See Table 1 and pp. 451-452  for information about laminar patterns of labeled neurons in areas 7a and LIP.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Comments: See Table 1 and pp. 451-452  for information about laminar patterns of labeled neurons in areas 7a and LIP.

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "Figure 7...The reconstruction on the left shows the distribution of the neurons that project to area 7a of the ipsilateral side."

@Injections.Citation: "Fast blue or true blue (5% solution) was injected into area 7a; nuclear yellow (2% solution) was injected into the prefrontal cortex...In each animal, two sets of dye injections were made; one dye was injected into the posterior parietal cortex and a second dye was injected into the contralateral prefrontal cortex...in case 83A-8 20 injections were made so as to label almost half of area 7a. In 83A-8 the injection site also included parts of areas 7b and LIP, but in the other two cases the injections were strictly confined to area 7a."

@Methods.Comments: The results of these injections were only mentioned indirectly and can thus not be reported in this database: "In a further group of seven monkeys single injections of labeled amino acids (seven hemispheres) or fluorescent dyes (three hemispheres) were made at different locations in areas 7a, 7b, and LIP. These brains were used to define the boundaries of the three areas, based on their afferent and efferent connections..." (p. 446)

@Injections.Citation: "In other experiments, we made single injections of...labeled amino acids (nine cases) in different parts of area 7a..."

@LabelledSites_Descriptions.Citation: "In other experiments, in which we made single injections of...labeled amino acids (nine cases) in different parts of area 7a, we always found that the heaviest labeling on the opposite site was in a region corresponding to the principal focus of the injection."

publication.title: Callosal and prefrontal associational projecting cell populations in area 7A of the macaque monkey: a study using retrogradely transported fluorescent dyes.
publication.abstract: The spatial interrelationship of neurons in area 7a in the inferior parietal lobule that project through the corpus callosum to the corresponding field in the contralateral hemisphere or to the ipsilateral prefrontal cortex has been analyzed in macaque monkeys by using double-labeling procedures with retrogradely transported fluorescent dyes. Although each pattern of labeling showed some discontinuities in density, there was no obvious periodicity within or between the spatial distributions of the two projecting populations. It was consistently observed that the cortex of the lateral wall of the intraparietal sulcus, adjacent to area 7a, projects more heavily to the prefrontal cortex than does area 7a itself.
